text.0: with all her eyes the goddess night looks forth approaching many a spot.
text.1: she hath put all her glories on.
text.2: immortal she hath filled the waste the goddess hath filled height and depth.
text.3: she conquers darkness with her light.
text.4: the goddess as she comes hath set the dawn her sister in her place.
text.6: so favour us this night o thou whose pathways we have visited.
text.7: as birds their nest upon the tree.
text.8: the villagers have sought their homes and all that walks and all that flies.
text.9: even the falcons fain for prey.
text.10: keep off the shewolf and the wolf o urmya keep the thief away.
text.11: easy be thou for us to pass.
text.12: clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues.
text.13: o morning cancel it like debts.
text.14: these have i brought to thee like kine o night thou child of heaven accept.
text.15: this laud as for a conqueror.
